FI.fi_add: Introduce a new capability (smallest viable slice).
FI.fi_fix: Repair a broken behavior without expanding scope.
FI.fi_change: Change an existing rule/behavior deliberately (not a fix).
FI.fi_upgrade: Improve internals/quality while preserving the external contract.

FU.fu_probe: Design a minimal probe to discriminate between causes/outcomes.
FU.fu_edges: Map edges/cliffs/tripwires and what signals them.
FU.fu_structure: Clarify structure/flow seams to reduce confusion and enable refactor.

FPR.fpr_mechanism: Explain mechanism with highlight framing (reader-facing clarity).
FPR.fpr_slice_map: Define/illustrate the slice boundary and its seams (what belongs where).
FPR.fpr_glossary: Align naming/terms to reduce ambiguity and drift.
FPR.fpr_walkthrough: Provide an experience-based walkthrough to reproduce/verify outcomes.

FP.fp_tripwires: Blueprint: Tripwires (dependencies, failure shapes, drift signals).

FA.fa_mechanism_model: One mechanism model (rules â†’ inevitable behavior).
FA.fa_family_placement: Place one mechanism in a pattern family (fingerprint + neighbors).

FS.fs_instantiate: Instantiate one abstraction into a concrete reusable shape.
FS.fs_stitch: Stitch two surfaces with a minimal adapter + seam guarantee.
FS.fs_jig: Enforce one constraint (validation/jig) at a boundary seam.
FS.fs_sibling: Add a missing sibling to an existing family (variant-axis expansion).
